availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elhannon W. Murphy (Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmer in Clay County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Clay County in 1850. Farmer in Clay County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons, including Permelia, Amanda, and Matilda, in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a captain from September 22, 1861, to May 1, 1863. Died of chronic diarrhea while in service in Cairo, Illinois, on May 1, 1863.
